_header: O ye women which been inclined
Note: The Envoy of Lydgate’s ‘Doublenesse’ occurring separately; see 5793.

BodAsh39.First Lines:
O ye women wyche be enclynedbe the enfflewens off your
                    natureTo be as pure as gold reffynedIn yowr trowth
                    tendure…
BodAsh39.Last Lines:
…sset uppon your brest your sselffe to assureA myghtty scheld
                    off dowbelnesse
BodAsh39.Note:
Now unreadable writing (possibly a name) occurs above the first
                    line.
BodAsh39.Editions:
Black,  William Henry. 
             Catalogi Codicum Manuscriptorum Bibliothecae Bodleianae…Pars X,
                A…Catalogue of the Manuscripts bequeathed…by Elias Ashmole.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1845: 61-2.
Lauritis,  Joseph Aloysius,
                        ed.  
             A Critical Edition ofJohn Lydgate’s Life of Our Lady.
Duquesne Studies, Philological Series
         2. Pittsburgh: Duquesne University, 1961; orig. ed. diss. University
            Pennsylvania 1951 (Ralph Albert Klinefelter); 1952 (Vernon F. Gallagher), 1958
            (Lauritis), in 3 vols: 40.

NapXIIIB29.First Lines:
O ye wymmen whiche been enclynedBi enfluence of ȝoure
                    nature…
NapXIIIB29.Last Lines:
…Set on ȝoure silue to assureA mighti schilde of
                    doblenesse
NapXIIIB29.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 2.70.
Vallese,  Tarquinio. 
             La Novella del Chierico di Oxford.
         Naples: A.G.D.A., 1939: 77.
